data.description: Ben Lukas Boysen, also known by his stage name Hecq, is an electronic music composer based in Berlin. (via Wikipedia)
data.name: Ben Lukas Boysen

data.description: Danny Kreutzfeldt covered a wide range of styles from deep ambient dub to vast harshnoise soundscapes and went on to perform, collaborate and release under numerous monikers before discontinuing most of these activities around 2008.
data.name: Danny Kreutzfeldt

data.description: Khruangbin (/ˈkrʌŋbɪn/ KRUNG-bin; Thai: [kʰrɯa̯ŋ˥˩.bin], เครื่องบิน) is an American musical trio from Houston, Texas. The band comprises Laura Lee on bass, Mark Speer on guitar, and Donald Ray "DJ" Johnson Jr. on drums.
data.name: Khruangbin

data.description: Rafael Anton Irisarri is an American composer, multi-instrumentalist, producer and mastering engineer based in New York. He is predominantly associated with post-minimalist, drone and electronic music.
data.name: Rafael Anton Irisarri

data.description: Rammstein is a German Neue Deutsche Härte band formed in Berlin in 1994.
data.name: Rammstein

data.description: Queensrÿche has sold over 20 million albums worldwide, including over 6 million albums in the United States. They are considered one of the leaders of the progressive metal scene of the mid-to-late 1980s, and often referred to as one of the "Big Three" of the genre.
data.name: Queensrÿche

data.description: Above & Beyond are an electronic music group consisting of English DJs Jono Grant, Tony McGuinness and Finnish DJ Paavo Siljamäki. Formed in 2000, they are the owners of London-based electronic dance music labels Anjunabeats and Anjunadeep, and also host a weekly radio show titled Group Therapy Radio.
data.name: Above and Beyond

data.description: Christian Löffler is a German electronic music producer, DJ, and visual artist known for his atmospheric and emotive soundscapes. Born in 1985, Löffler combines elements of deep house, ambient, and techno, often incorporating his own field recordings and organic textures to create a distinctive, melancholic yet uplifting style. He has released several acclaimed albums, including "A Forest" (2012), "Mare" (2016), and "Graal (Prologue)" (2019). Löffler's music often explores themes of nature and introspection, and he is also recognized for his artistic contributions, blending visual art with his musical performances.
data.name: Christian Löffler

data.description: Glass Animals are an English indie rock band formed in Oxford in 2010.
data.name: Glass Animals

data.description: Samuel Shepherd, known professionally as Floating Points, is a British electronic music producer, DJ, and musician.
data.name: Floating Points
